definitions.definition: Special weight or forcefulness given to something considered important .
examples: He paused for emphasis before saying who had won.

definitions.definition: Special attention or prominence given to something.
examples: Anglia TV's emphasis is on Norwich and district.
Put emphasis on the advantages rather than the drawbacks.

definitions.definition: Prominence given to a syllable or words , by raising the voice or printing in italic or underlined type .
examples: He used a yellow highlighter to indicate where to give emphasis in his speech.

definitions.definition: The phonetic or phonological feature that distinguishes emphatic consonants from other consonants.
The use of boldface , italics , or other such formatting to highlight text. (Can we add an example for this sense?)

main_definition: Special weight or forcefulness given to something considered important .
secondary_definitions: Special attention or prominence given to something.
Prominence given to a syllable or words , by raising the voice or printing in italic or underlined type .
( phonology ) The phonetic or phonological feature that distinguishes emphatic consonants from other consonants.
( typography ) The use of boldface , italics , or other such formatting to highlight text. (Can we add an example for this sense?)
